content.title: Technology Development And Utilization Programme For Women
content.details: In order to meet the specific needs of women and to enhance the contribution of women towards technology capability building, the “Technology Development & Utilization Programme for Women (TDUPW)” has been formulated by the Department of Scientific and Industrial Research (DSIR). DSIR has a mandate to carry out activities relating to indigenous technology promotion, development, utilization and transfer. DSIR under its “Technology Development and Utilization Programme for Women (TDUPW)” provides assistance for those projects which are relevant to technology development and utilization by the women.
benefits: Promoting the adoption of new technologies by women.
Awareness creation and training of women on technology-related issues with regard to women.
Promoting Technological upgradation of tiny, small and medium enterprises run by women entrepreneurs.
Showcasing appropriate technologies and organizing demonstration programmes for the benefit of women.
Design and development of products, and processes beneficial to women.
eligibility: Studies/ surveys for the assessment of technology-related information needs of women in different walks of life.
Documentation and content development on technologies useful for production activities, personal care and community management.
Establishing Consultancy Cells for imparting technical knowledge on the adoption of the latest technologies.
Awareness creation and training of women in technologies useful for production activities.
Case studies of successful R&D, Technology Development and businesswomen.
exclusions: No support will be provided for basic infrastructure and buildings.
content.application_process: Offline and Online. The applications are open throughout the year. One set of hard copy of the proposal, along with the required (self-attested) documents, should be sent by speed post to Dr. Sujata Chaklanobis, Scientist 'G' and Head A2K+, Department of Scientific and Industrial Research, Technology Bhawan, New Mehrauli Road, New Delhi-110016.
documents_required: Letter of forwarding the project proposal and an undertaking from the head of the institution.
Certificate of Responsibility and Commitment from Investigators.
Technical and financial details of the proposal.
A Copy of the Registration Certificate (for institutions other than Government).
A Copy of the Annual Report for the last 3 years (for institutions other than Government).
A Copy of the Auditor’s Report for the last 3 years (for institutions other than Government).

faqs.question: What Is The Full Name Of The TDUPW Scheme?
faqs.answer: The full name of the TDUPW Scheme is 'Technology Development & Utilization Programme for Women'.

faqs.question: For What Kinds Of Projects Is The Assistance Provided?
faqs.answer: In this scheme, DSIR provides assistance for those projects which are relevant to technology development and utilization by women.

faqs.question: What Objectives Does This Scheme Have?
faqs.answer: This scheme has the following objectives - 1. Promoting the adoption of new technologies by women. 2. Awareness creation and training of women on technology-related issues with regard to women. 3. Promoting Technological upgradation of tiny, small and medium enterprises run by women entrepreneurs. 4. Showcasing appropriate technologies and organizing demonstration programmes for the benefit of women. 5. Design and development of products, and processes beneficial to women.

faqs.question: What Shall Be The Duration Of The Project? Is The Duration Fixed?
faqs.answer: The project should be time-bound, depending upon the nature of the project. Normally a duration of less than 2 years is preferred.

faqs.question: Will The Financial Assistance Be Provided As A Lump Sum Or In Installments?
faqs.answer: The assistance can be by way of financial support (partial or full) and technical guidance.

faqs.question: Will The Assistance Also Be Provided For Basic Infrastructure?
faqs.answer: No support will be provided for basic infrastructure and buildings.
